Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the incident by stating that the image shows a child beaten by a Hong Kong police officer in April 2020, when in fact the image has circulated since at least June 2018, unrelated to the alleged child abuse incident in Hong Kong.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any concrete evidence or sources to verify the specific incident mentioned.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image is related to the alleged child abuse incident involving a Hong Kong police officer, without providing sufficient evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The image has an alternative explanation as it was originally shared in 2018, depicting a child beaten by his biological mother in Guangdong, China. This alternative explanation contradicts the claim made in the post.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image has been circulating since 2018, while the alleged incident in Hong Kong was reported in April 2020.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
